Instance.description: The Sim creates an object in a slot as part of a crafting process.

Tunable.name: ignore_object_placmenent_verification
Tunable.description: If enabled, when parenting the object at the end of crafting process the placement of the object will ignore verification like slot validation and slot availability. This is valid to tune ONLY if we are guaranteeing this phase of the crafting process will delete the ico, since if its not deleted, on save load we will have two object on the same spot and build buy will push one to the household inventory. An example of a valid use case for this is the pumpkin carving station where the ico is a carved generic pumpking and we want to replace it for the final product on the same slot.

TunableTuple.name: parenting_element
TunableTuple.description: Use this element to instruct the game where the newly-created object should go. The constraint to ensure the slot is empty will be created automatically.

Tunable.name: _check_part_owner
Tunable.description: If enabled and parent object is a part, the test will be run on the part owner instead.

TunableEnum.name: _parent_object
TunableEnum.description: The participant of an interaction to which an object will be parented.

TunableVariant.name: _parent_slot
TunableVariant.description: The slot on the parent object where the child object should go. This may be either the exact name of a bone on the parent object or a slot type, in which case the first empty slot of the specified type in which the child object fits will be used.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the child object should go. No placement validation will be done on this slot, as long as it is empty the child will always be placed there. This should only be used on slots the player isn't allowed to use in build mode, as in the original design for the service slots on the bar, or by GPEs testing out functionality before modelers and designers have settled on slot types and names for a particular design.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the child object should go. The first empty slot found on the parent of the specified type in which the child object fits will be used. If no such slot is found, the parenting will not occur and the interaction will be canceled.

TunableTuple.name: success_chance
TunableTuple.description: The percentage chance that this action will be applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: timing
TunableVariant.description: Determines the exact timing of the behavior, either at the beginning of an interaction, the end, or when an xevt occurs in an animation played as part of the interaction.

TunableTuple.name: at_beginning
TunableTuple.description: The behavior should occur at the very beginning of the interaction. It will not be tightly synchronized visually with animation. This isn't a very common use case and would most likely be used in an immediate interaction or to change hidden state that is used for bookkeeping rather than visual appearance.

TunableVariant.name: offset_time
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the interaction will wait this amount of time after the beginning before running the element. Only use this if absolutely necessary. Better alternatives include using xevts, time based conditional action with loot ops, and using outcomes.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The interaction will wait this amount of time after the beginning before running the element

TunableTuple.name: at_end
TunableTuple.description: The behavior should occur at the end of the interaction. It will not be tightly synchronized visually with animation. An example might be an object that gets dirty every time a Sim uses it (so using a commodity change is overkill) but no precise synchronization with animation is desired, as might be the case with vomiting in the toilet.

TunableEnum.name: criticality
TunableEnum.description: Determines the condition in which it will run. NotCritical - If the interaction is cancelled or reset out of, it will not run. OnCancel - If the interaction is cancelled, it will run, but not if it is reset out of. OnCancelOrException - If the interaction is cancelled or reset out of, it will run. RunAll - It will always run.

TunableTuple.name: on_xevt
TunableTuple.description: The behavior should occur synchronized visually with an xevt in an animation played as part of the interaction. If for some reason such an event doesn't occur, the behavior will occur at the end of the interaction unless supports failsafe is False. This is by far the most common use case, as when a Sim flushes a toilet and the water level should change when the actual flush animation and effects fire.

TunableEnum.name: criticality
TunableEnum.description: Determines the condition in which it will run. NotCritical - If the interaction is cancelled or reset out of, it will not run. OnCancel - If the interaction is cancelled, it will run, but not if it is reset out of. OnCancelOrException - If the interaction is cancelled or reset out of, it will run. RunAll - It will always run.

Tunable.name: supports_failsafe
Tunable.description: If checked and the x-event does not fire, the basic extra will still run at the end of the interaction as a fail-safe.
